english: to refine; refined; fine processing; highly processed

etymology.description: 精 (“refined; fine”) + 制/製 (“to make; manufacture”) = refine; fine processing.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of fineness/purity with making/processing to express producing something with high precision or further purification. Used both as a verb (to refine/process) and as an adjective (refined; highly processed).
etymology.simplification: 製 was simplified to 制 to reduce strokes and unify forms in the PRC, so 精製 → 精制; intuitively, the 衣 component in 製 was dropped and merged with 制.

examples.chinese: 这家工厂专门精制高纯度的盐(這家工廠專門精製高純度的鹽)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā gōngchǎng zhuānmén jīngzhì gāo chúndù de yán.
examples.english: This factory specializes in refining high-purity salt.

examples.chinese: 这种精制糖口感很好(這種精製糖口感很好)，但营养价值较低(但營養價值較低)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng jīngzhì táng kǒugǎn hěn hǎo, dàn yíngyǎng jiàzhí jiào dī.
examples.english: This refined sugar tastes good, but its nutritional value is relatively low.

examples.chinese: 通过精制工艺(透過精製工藝)，产品表面更加光滑(產品表面更加光滑)。
examples.pinyin: Tōngguò jīngzhì gōngyì, chǎnpǐn biǎomiàn gèngjiā guānghuá.
examples.english: Through fine refining techniques, the product surface becomes smoother.
